accessrestrict.head: Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry (V0223). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

did.unittitle: 3rd Annual William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry [videorecording]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [1] Welcome and introduction / Carl Djerassi. Session Chair: Carl Djerassi. Synthesis and natural products / Samuel Danishefsky. Molecular recognition by Vancomycin group antibiotics / Dudley H. Williams; [2] Session Chair: Lisa McElwee-White. The interplay between enzyme mechanisms, protein structure, and the design of biologically active compounds / Paul A. Bartlett. What triggers vision? / Koji Nakanishi; [3] Session Chair: Barry M. Trost. The evolution of enzyme function / Jeremy R. Knowles. Recent advances in asymmetric catalysis / K. Barry Sharpless; [4] Session Chair: Paul A. Wender. Organic container compounds / Donald J. Cram. Closing remarks / William S. Johnson.

did.unittitle: 4th Annual William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry [videorecording]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [1] Welcome and introduction / Carl Djerassi. Session Chair: Paul A. Wender. Studies in asymmetric synthesis / David A. Evans. Polyene cyclization as a method of alkaloid synthesis / Clayton H. Heathcock; [2] Session Chair: Lisa McElwee-White. Asymmetric synthesis catalyzed by metal complexes / Ryoji Noyori. Polymer synthesis using organometallic catalysts / Robert H. Grubbs; [3] Session Chair: Barry M. Trost. Synthetic and biosynthetic research on pigments of life / Alan R. Battersby. Recent advances in enantioselective biocatalysis / Charles J. Sih; [4] Session Chair: Dale G. Drueckhammer. Studies on the enzymic synthesis of penicillian and cephalosphorin / Jack E. Baldwin. Closing remarks / Carl Djerassi.

did.unittitle: 6th Annual William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry [videorecording]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [1] Welcome and introduction / Paul A. Wender. Announcement: Tetrahedron Prize Winner is William S. Johnson / Derek H. R. Barton. Session Chair: Lisa McElwee-White. Reactive intermediates, reaction mechanisms / Jerome A. Berson; [2] Session Chair: Lisa McElwee-White. Computational explorations of molecular recognition and organic reactions in solution / William L. Jorgensen; [3] Session Chair: Barry M. Trost. Polymer synthesis at the boundaries of biology and solid state science / Harry R. Allcock; [4] Session Chair: Barry M. Trost. The diaryl-methanol group in auxiliaries for stoichiometric and catalytic enantioselective synthesis / Dieter Seebach; [5] Session Chair: John H. Griffin. Design, synthesis, and evaluation of functional analogs of CC-1065 and the duocarmycins / Dale L. Boger; [6] Session Chair: John H. Griffin. New opportunities at the interface of chemistry and biology / Peter G. Schultz; [7] Session Chair: Dale G. Drueckhammer. Studies on peptidoglycan assembly in bacterial cell wall biosynthesis and vancomycin resistance / Christopher T. Walsh. Closing remarks / John I. Brauman.

did.unittitle: 8th Annual William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry [videorecording]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [1] Session Chair: Robert M. Waymouth. Transition metals in organic synthesis. Organometallic approaches to amino acids and small peptides / Louis S. Hegedus; [2] Session Chair: Barry M. Trost. Synthesis and chemistry of spiroketals / Steven V. Ley. Recognition, replication and assembly / Julius Rebeck, Jr.; [3] [Session Chair: Not videotaped.] The depletion of stratospheric ozone by chlorofluorocarbons / F. Sherwood Rowland. A chemical perspective on protein folding and DNA-protein interactions / Alanna Schepartz; [4] Session Chair: Dale G. Drueckhammer. The design of inhibitors for biological processes / George M. Whitesides. Closing remarks / Barry M. Trost.

did.unittitle: 9th Annual William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry [videorecording]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [1] Welcome and introduction / Paul A. Wender. Session Chair: John H. Griffin. Molecular and polymeric carbon allotropes / François Diederich; [2] Comments (books, biographies, authorship) / Carl Djerassi. Session Chair: John H. Griffin. Microchemistry and biochips / Stephen P.A. Fodor [3] Session Chair: Robert M. Waymouth. n-Pentenyl glycosides--a contemporary case of serendipity--impact on synthetic, mechanistic, and theoretical aspects of carbohydrate and organic chemistry / Bert Fraser-Reid; [4] Session Chair: Robert M. Waymouth. Flexible molecules with defined shape / Reinhard W. Hoffmann; [5] Session Chair: John. I. Brauman. Superelectrophiles and their reactions / George A. Olah; [6] Session Chair: Dale G. Drueckhammer. Recent progress on chemo-enzymatic synthesis--application to the study of carbohydrate recognition / Chi-Huey Wong. Symposium summary / Barry M. Trost.

did.unittitle: 10th Annual William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry [videorecording]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [1] Welcome and introduction / Paul A. Wender. Session Chair: Andrew Streitwieser. Oxygen and I / Derek H. R. Barton; [2] Session Chair: Andrew Streitwieser. A rabid interest in Hydrophobia / Ronald Breslow; [3] Session Chair: Andrew Streitwieser. The search for carbocations / George A. Olah; [4] Session Chair: Dale G. Drueckhammer. Olefin metathesis catalysts for Organic synthesis / Robert Grubbs; [5] Session Chair: Dale G. Drueckhammer. Chemistry of p-RNQA, the Pyranosyl Isomer of RNA / Albert Eschenmoser; [6] Session Chair: Paul A. Bartlett. Peptide related research : a vehicle toward biological and chemical understanding / Ralph F. Hirschmann; [7] Session Chair: Paul A. Bartlett. Asymmetric hydrogenation / Ryoji Noyori [8] Session Chair: Paul A. Bartlett. Why is a natural product with eight stereocenter racemic? / Clayton Heathcock; [9] Session Chair: Robert G. Bergman. Noncovalent binding phenomena in asymmetric catalysis / Barry Sharpless; [10] Session Chair: Robert G. Bergman. Progress and problems in the synthesis of the Veratrum alkaloid germine / Gilbert Stork. Symposium summary, Barry M. Trost.

did.unittitle: 11th Annual William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry [videorecording]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [1] Welcome and introduction / Paul A. Wender. Session Chair: John H. Griffin. Novel polymer architectures for controlling photoinduced electron transfer / Marye Anne Fox; [2] Session Chair: John H. Griffin. The discovery and development of a new therapy for AIDS / Joel R. Huff; [3] Session Chair: Robert M. Waymouth. New reactions and directions involving chiral coordination complexes / Eric N. Jacobsen; [4] Session Chair: Robert M. Waymouth. New cyclization reactions and their application in natural products total synthesis / Larry E. Overman; [5] Session Chair: Thomas Wandless. Progress in the discovery of naturally occurring anticancer drugs / George R. Pettit; [6] Session Chair: Thomas Wandless. Lessons from the immune system: from catalysis to materials / Peter G. Schulz; [7] Session Chair: Barry M. Trost. The chemical biology of DNA Methylation / Gregory L. Verdine. Symposium summary, Barry M. Trost.

did.unittitle: 13th Annual William S. Johnson Symposium in Organic Chemistry [videorecording]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [1] Welcome and introduction / Barry M. Trost. [Session Chair: Not videotaped.] Pericyclic reactions : from femtosecond dynamics to antibody catalysis / K. N. Houk; [2] Session Chair: Thomas Wandless. Mechanistic studies in photochemistry enzyme photoactivation : Fishing for proteases / Ned A. Porter; [3] Session Chair: Barry M. Trost. Design of chiral ligands for asymmetric catalysis / Andreas Pfaltz; [4] Session Chair: Barry M. Trost. Transition metal catalyzed olefin polymerizations and copolymerizations / Maurice Brookhart; [5] Session Chair: Robert M. Waymouth. New directions in marine natural products chemistry / William Fenical; [6] [Session Chair: Not videotaped.] A new approach to antibiotics agains drug-resistant organisms / Sidney Altman; [7] Session Chair: Robert M. Waymouth. Terpine biosynthesis revisited / Duilio Arigoni. Symposium summary, Paul A. Wender.
